snippet: Second-generation Ethiopian-Israelis say they are still struggling to be accepted as Israeli, and are distancing themselves from the grateful passivity of their parents.
abstract: New generation of Ethiopian-Israelis are protesting against racism and discrimination, in response to a number of ugly episodes; for many Israelis, the idea that Jews could be racist toward other Jews is anathema; 1991 airlift, known as Operation Solomon, brought 14,000 Ethiopian Jews to Israel and was greeted at the time with great celebration; but a second generation of young, educated adults who have grown up in Israel say they are still struggling to be accepted as Israeli.
lead_paragraph: Second-generation Ethiopian-Israelis say they are still struggling to be accepted as Israeli, and are distancing themselves from the grateful passivity of their parents.

headline.main: New Generation of Ethiopians March Toward Dream of Acceptance in Israel
headline.print_headline: Second-Generation Ethiopians in Israel March Toward Dream of Acceptance
